
Accuracy, Precision, and Recall.
--------------------------------

1. DATA

Below is the complete data gathered for this section. Each subsection contains 10 figures,
each corresponding to one the training files.

For the precision and recall subsections, each data point is a 2-tuple, with
each element corresponding to the different row/column.

1.1 Accuracy of SVM
--------
[0.6272727272727273, 0.5963636363636363, 0.6163636363636363, 0.6381818181818182, 0.6254545454545455,
 0.6163636363636363, 0.6190909090909091, 0.6163636363636363, 0.5990909090909091, 0.6147540983606558]
Average: 0.616929955291

Average: (0.573751945686, 0.585926809074)

------------------

2. Statiscal Significance (p-values)

2.1. SVM and Decision Trees
pvalue=0.0002912786617141556

2.2. SVM and Naive Bayes
pvalue=0.00063081840212985199

2.3. Naive Bayes and Decision Trees
pvalue=0.0098719456858973008

2.4. Description
It appears that all 3 had strong significance (p < 0.001).
Of the 3, naive bayes and decision trees were the least significant,
while decision trees and SVM were the most.
